body:
You may have noticed your guild subscriber count dropping. We noticed that we had somehow duplicated about 7000 guild membership records. We've added a database constraint to ensure it won't happen again (and did similar things with other types of relationship records, like user-user follows).

Since the duplicate records have been removed, guild membership counts have dropped by 1 for each corresponding duplicate record removed.
body_html:
You may have noticed your guild subscriber count dropping. We noticed that we had somehow duplicated about 7000 guild membership records. We've added a database constraint to ensure it won't happen again (and did similar things with other types of relationship records, like user-user follows).

Since the duplicate records have been removed, guild membership counts have dropped by 1 for each corresponding duplicate record removed.
title: Fixed duplicate user-guild subscription records

body: What probably happened is that it was just one guy and he either unsubscribed or accidentally clicked the button one too many times and got unsubscribed. Then his duplicates stayed there but the real one left.
body_html: What probably happened is that it was just one guy and he either unsubscribed or accidentally clicked the button one too many times and got unsubscribed. Then his duplicates stayed there but the real one left.

body: I think this actually removed some legitimate user followings. I lost all 7 of mine, and I noticed all the other users lost most of theirs too. People who previously followed me now no longer do. And I myself am also no longer following the users I had been prior to this change.

post.body:
You may have noticed your guild subscriber count dropping. We noticed that we had somehow duplicated about 7000 guild membership records. We've added a database constraint to ensure it won't happen again (and did similar things with other types of relationship records, like user-user follows).

Since the duplicate records have been removed, guild membership counts have dropped by 1 for each corresponding duplicate record removed.

post.body:
You may have noticed your guild subscriber count dropping. We noticed that we had somehow duplicated about 7000 guild membership records. We've added a database constraint to ensure it won't happen again (and did similar things with other types of relationship records, like user-user follows).

Since the duplicate records have been removed, guild membership counts have dropped by 1 for each corresponding duplicate record removed.
post.body_html:
You may have noticed your guild subscriber count dropping. We noticed that we had somehow duplicated about 7000 guild membership records. We've added a database constraint to ensure it won't happen again (and did similar things with other types of relationship records, like user-user follows).

Since the duplicate records have been removed, guild membership counts have dropped by 1 for each corresponding duplicate record removed.
post.title: Fixed duplicate user-guild subscription records

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
Hijacking top comment to say they need to implement a service worker + local browser storage schema to vastly improve performance and lower server bills!!!!

Edit service worker captures browser location and get requests and checks them against a local storage database on the user machine. Users in connectivity download assets and resources and can then view them offline. When going from offline to online the service worker will do a request and update the post list in feeds without user intervention. This shit takes like an hour to do it’s super simple especially for technical guys like I see on the github. 

The only time you end up needing to make a request is when there are new posts or comments. Service worker will make it possible to do endless scrolling rather easy down the road. You tie the service worker into your lazy loader so images only download when intersected. That way even in low connectivity people can at least read posts and comments which are infinitely smaller in size than images and videos. Users on chrome will especially see a marked improvement if assets are converted to webp or whatever. All of this shit was made by google for big data so we need to be doing that shit especially when it’s so easy. Also make this a pwa it takes five minutes.
body_html:
Hijacking top comment to say they need to implement a service worker + local browser storage schema to vastly improve performance and lower server bills!!!!

Edit service worker captures browser location and get requests and checks them against a local storage database on the user machine. Users in connectivity download assets and resources and can then view them offline. When going from offline to online the service worker will do a request and update the post list in feeds without user intervention. This shit takes like an hour to do it’s super simple especially for technical guys like I see on the github.

The only time you end up needing to make a request is when there are new posts or comments. Service worker will make it possible to do endless scrolling rather easy down the road. You tie the service worker into your lazy loader so images only download when intersected. That way even in low connectivity people can at least read posts and comments which are infinitely smaller in size than images and videos. Users on chrome will especially see a marked improvement if assets are converted to webp or whatever. All of this shit was made by google for big data so we need to be doing that shit especially when it’s so easy. Also make this a pwa it takes five minutes.
